author: Maureen P
title: Home away from home
text:
I stayed at Club Quarters for 16 nights after selling my apartment and waiting for my temporary sublet to be available and by the time I left, I felt as if I was leaving home. Accommodations were immaculate and up-to-date, service was excellent, and the amenities for a hotel in this price range were above average; fresh fruit, biscotti, and self-service lattes, espresso, and sparkling water on tap in the lobby, Many mornings I enjoyed my latte with the NYT, catching the news in the comfortable TV lounge. The complimentary laundry facilities were a real treat to me during my extended stay and I made frequent use of the gym.
We had booked a standard king which was on the 8th floor; when my husband complained about the A/C roof unit noise from across the street (not the hotel's fault) we were moved to a 14th floor room with a large terrace. Despite the cold, we still ventured out there to enjoy the city views of the Oculus and 9-11 Memorial.
Beds were very comfortable and an ample supply of pillows as well as other amenities were available in a closet down the hall.
Despite all the nearby restaurants in the area and the generally mediocre reputation of hotel restaurants, I ended up trying the rooftop restaurant one night after a stressful day at work. What a surprise! The spectacular view of the city, West Street, and the Hudson River was worth a visit by itself, but my sea bass cooked Asian-style in a broth, with tasty bread and a glass of wine, hit the spot. I ended up going back for happy hour one night (every evening 5-7) and dinner a couple of more times.
The location was perfect for me to get to work every day; only a couple of blocks from the 1 and R trains. Even though I am a New Yorker, there are still some sights I have yet to explore so I played tourist during the weekend - besides the Memorial there are still many things to see not far from the hotel.
All in all, I highly recommend this Club Quarters to anyone looking for a leisure weekend or business stay.
